meanings.definition: To throw or cast under or beneath.
meanings.sent1: She tried to underthrow the ball to her teammate during the game.
meanings.sent2: He accidentally underthrew the frisbee, causing it to fall short of the target.
meanings.sent3: The magician's trick involved underthrowing the coin into his shoe.
meanings.sent4: The artist underthrew the paint onto the canvas, creating a unique effect.
meanings.sent5: The chef underthrew the pancake onto the plate, adding a touch of flair to the presentation.

meanings.definition: A throw or cast made beneath or below.
meanings.sent1: The underthrow of the fishing net caught many small fish near the riverbed.
meanings.sent2: The quarterback's underthrow was intercepted by the opposing team's player.
meanings.sent3: The underthrow of the dart landed right on the bullseye, much to everyone's surprise.
meanings.sent4: The underthrow of the anchor caused the boat to drift slowly in the calm waters.
meanings.sent5: The underthrow of the dice resulted in a low number, much to the player's disappointment.
